column5: Hey all,  Have some repairs to do. (2 wheel hubs and a catalytic)  I've been looking around online for an auto parts supplier. Prefer Canadian.  Anyone have a online store they use and are happy with?  Thanks.
Autopartsway.ca  my dad uses it all the time...
Parts Monkey (in London I believe) www.partsmonkey.com ... quick and easy, but you might find the local carquest is cheaper for a set of hubs once you pay shipping.

Thanks Wayne.  Found a bunch on eBay too, free shipping... not sure on quality however. Can't beat the $ though.  http://www.ebay.ca/itm/FRONT-WHEEL-HUB-BEARING-ASSEMBLY-GMC-JIMMY-S15-T15-1999-2000-2001-2005-513124-/200920691936?pt=Motors_Car_Truck_Parts_Accessories&hash=item2ec7ce74e0&vxp=mtr

Front hubs... don't mess around. Carquest sells an economy and a good one with timken bearings in it (Moog). Spend the extra for the work involved in changing them. Considering Leah's Sporttrac ate the first ones at 62,000 km... and I made them redo the left front a 1000 km later.. and I just did it again at 155,000 km. Make sure they're the good ones.  .. I have to thank Bernie for holding my hand through me doing Leah's truck. You get one shot at tightening the spindle / shaft nut to the proper torque.
